contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather. Let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, the heatwave we experienced today is gradually starting to subside now, as we have rainfall in forecast for the weekend. What's the condition looking like now?

Well, Conn-young. The sky is filling with clouds at a faster rate now as we're getting close to the end of the day. Rain is expected starting this evening and this will sweep away the summer heatwave we’ve been having. Showers will begin starting from the western regions and wil graually expand towards the east by late tonight. By early tomorrow morning, rain wll have spread nationwide.

Looking at the precipitation levels. In the West Coast and parts of inland regions approximately 30 to 80mm of rain are forecasted. And in Jeju and Southern areas, heavy rain of 50 to 100mm per hour and even strong thunders are to come along, so please be aware. Rain in most regions are expected to continue until Sunday.

It will be a cool morning tomorrow with Seoul at 15 degrees and Busan16.

Daytime temperatures will hover around 20 to 22 degrees and will be fairly mild.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will be partly sunny and Beijing will be mostly cloudy throughout the day.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Rain in forecast for tonight...heat to diminish
Updated: 2020-05-08 17:29:52 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. Some much needed rain is in store nationwide. We'll be seeing rain from this evening in the west before it spreads to the rest of the country by tonight. Jeju and southern coastal regions will see 50 to 100 millimeters, Seoul will see between 30 to 80 into Saturday.

Temperatures will return to seasonal norms tomorrow but due to the summer like readings we've had lately it could feel like a significant cool down with dark clouds. So if you have special plan for Parents' Day weekend take the weather into account

Blue skies will be abundant in eastern parts of the country during the day. It's going to be a warm afternoon. Seoul, Gyeongju and Chuncheon getting up to 26 degrees,

Sunshine and balmy temperatures are in store next week. Readings on the rise again

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Rain from tonight into Saturday
Updated: 2020-05-08 07:19:43 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. You are going to need an umbrella today, we'll be seeing rain from this evening in the western parts of the country and it will gradually spread to the rest of the country by tonight and will rain into Saturday evening or even into Sunday for certain regions.

Jeju and southern coastal regions will see 50 to 100 millimeters possibly 150 in the island's mountains. 10 to 80 millimeters of somewhat heavy rainfall so those have some special plan to mark Parents' Day will need to take the rainy weather into account.

Morning temperatures are similar to few notches lower than yesterday, ranging from 8 to 15 degrees Celsius bright skies to start the day.

Afternoon highs will be a tad lower but still higher than seasonal norms in most parts. Daegu will notice highs jumping 4 degrees.

Temperatures are forecast to return closer to seasonal norms this weekend.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

contents.headline:
Rain forecast from this evening into Saturday
Updated: 2020-05-08 06:01:42 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather. For that, let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, today was also pretty warm, with above-average temperatures across the country. But I hear it's going to cool down with some rain on Parents Day tomorrow?

Right, Conn-young. Like you mentioned, we experienced some intense heat during the daytime as temperatures were running about 4 degrees above average for this time of the year. However, for tomorrow we can expect lower temperatures with more clouds than sunshine. On Saturday, we'll be seeing daytime highs of 20 degrees in Seoul.

The reason the heat is subsiding is rain. It'll start in the western regions tomorrow night and will expand towards the east. By Saturday, rain clouds will have expanded all across the nation, and showers are expected to continue until Sunday. The south coast and Jeju Island will be seeing quite a lot of precipiation up to 30mm so please be aware.

We'll start off with cloudy spells tomorrow. Seoul will begin the day at 14 degrees, Gyeongju 8 and Daegu 11.

Daytime highs will be about 1 to 3 degrees lower than today's. Seoul, Gyeongju and Daegu will be 24 degrees.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will see sunny spells and Beijing will have cloudy skies.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Early summer heat in the west, rain in forecast for Parents' Day
Updated: 2020-05-07 17:10:42 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. We can expect a similar weather pattern today for most regions. It will be a warm day in Seoul while eastern parts of the country will have another cool day, highs in the upper teens hovering 5 degrees below the seasonal norms and it's going to be another cool day.

Bright sunlight to be with us all day, UV levels to very high levels in many southern parts of the country and Jeju. Air quality will be normal to good nationwide.

Upper regions will be as warm as yesterday but southern provinces will have similar to a few notches lower daytime highs. Gwangju will be 4 degrees lower at 26 degrees.

Welcome rain in store for Parents' Day tomorrow, showers will linger into early Saturday. That band of rain will bring seasonal temperatures to Seoul.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Warm spell continues in west with wide temperature gaps
Updated: 2020-05-07 05:56:11 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather. For that, let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, it was on the cool side yesterday for Children's Day, but it seems like the heat is back again. In western regions such as Gwangju, it got up to almost 30 degrees. When is the heat going to ease?

Well, Conn-young. Hot and dry weather is likely to prevail until Friday. Tomorrow will see sunshine and high temperatures across the country, with daytime highs hovering around 25, 26 degrees. On the east coast, where chilly easterly winds are blowing, temperatures will be relatively lower. The combination of hot days and warm nights is expected to increase the threat of heat-related illness, so please be aware.

Meanwhile, the air is still dry. Advisories have been issued in Gyeonggi-do and Gangwon-do provinces, so please take precautions against forest fires. Dry conditions are expected to begin subsiding on Friday, when rain is in forecast.

Taking a look at our readings for tomorrow. Seoul and Gwangju will start the day at 14 degrees, and Daegu at 11.

Daytime highs will be a bit lower than today's with Seoul at 26 degrees and Busan at 20 degrees.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will see some light showers and Beijing will have cloudy spells.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Summer heat in western regions, dry advisories in Gyeonggi, Gangwon-do province
Updated: 2020-05-06 17:05:37 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. The weather is set to heat up again, Seoul could see the season's warmest temperatures so far this afternoon, but it is going to be another cool day in the east with readings hovering in the upper teens to low twenties.

Morning fog has cleared and sunshine is in store for the entire country. UV levels will be pretty strong across the country so don't forget your sunscreen.

Speaking of which, as the weather gets warmer many of us will spend more time outdoors so we need to protect ourselves from the strong sunshine. Here are some tips to choose right sunscreen depending on your activity.

A warm and sunny afternoon is in store for most parts, Seoul at 28 degrees Celsius, Gwangju at 30 degrees.

The warming trend will come to an end with nationwide rain that's forecast to fall from Friday afternoon into Saturday, and will put the brakes on this summer-like heat.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Summer heat surges in west
Updated: 2020-05-06 08:56:20 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. After a cool and somewhat wet Children's Day, the summer heat returns today. It's likely Seoul could see the season's warmest temperatures so far this afternoon but it is a chilly morning so be aware of the big gaps in readings and dress accordingly for your morning and evening commute.

Dry weather alerts have been lifted for many regions only lingering in parts of Gangwon-do and Gyeoggi-do Province, while UV levels will be pretty strong across the country don't forget your sunscreen.

This morning, lows are ranging from the low to mid teens while central regions and Gyeongsangbuk-do Province are covered with thick layers of fog.

A warm and sunny afternoon in store for most parts, Seoul at 28 degrees, Gwangju at 30 degrees.

The warming trend will come to an end with nationwide rain on Saturday putting the brakes on this summer-like heat.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
